# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o): 
Content: "Photo: 19 October 2024 <image:6628>EPA

Israeli police sealed off the site of a reported drone attack in the northern town of Caesarea

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said he is undeterred from his war aims following a reported drone attack on his private residence.

"The attempt by Iran’s proxy Hezbollah to assassinate me and my wife today was a grave mistake," he wrote in a post on X.

His office earlier said a drone was "launched towards" his residence in the northern coastal town of Caesarea on Saturday morning.

Mr Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time, and no one was injured.

Iran says Hezbollah was behind the reported attack, Iranian state news agency IRNA reported.

Iran's mission to the UN was quoted as saying: "The action in question has been carried out by Hezbollah in Lebanon”.

Hezbollah - which is funded and equipped by Iran - has not commented on the reports.

*   [Bowen: Sinwar's death is serious blow to Hamas, but not the end of the war](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cm24q3204y3o)
    

The Israeli military said three drones were launched from Lebanon, with one hitting a building in Caesarea.

They did not confirm whether the building was part of the prime minister's residence, nor the extent of any damage.

US outlet Axios reported that the drone did hit the residence.

At 08:19 local time (06:19 BST), the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said: "In the last hour, three unmanned aerial vehicles crossed into the country from Lebanon.

"Two of the aircraft were intercepted.

Netanyahu says he is undeterred after reported drone attack on his home

19 October 2024

Jaroslav LukivBBC News

! <image:6627>!EPA Israeli police guard on the site of a reported drone attack in the northern Israeli town of Caesarea. Another aircraft hit a building in Caesarea, no injuries."

The Israeli prime minister makes use of two private homes, in Caesarea and Jerusalem, and has also spent time at Beit Aghion, his official residence in Jerusalem, which is currently being renovated.

The reported attack comes as Israel prepares to respond to Iran's large-scale ballistic missile attack on 1 October - with Israel's defence minister saying its response would be "deadly, precise and surprising".

The article states that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. The article mentions that Iran's proxy Hezbollah was behind the attack.

Video shows damage to Netanyahu’s beach house as Hezbollah claims drone attack

[](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/irene-nasser)

![This image shows damage to the exterior of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, on October 22, 2024.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/xgafrp8bxqaaau7f.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_833,w_1480,c_fill)

This image shows damage to the exterior of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, on October 22, 2024.

From Social Media

CNN  — 

The beachside home of Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu was damaged in a drone strike claimed by Hezbollah, video footage geolocated by CNN shows, in an attack that penetrated deep inside Israel even as the militant group reels from sustained Israeli bombardment.

Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time of Saturday’s attack in the coastal city of Caesarea and no-one was injured, according to Israeli officials.

But the incident has raised questions about how the drone evaded Israel’s air defenses even after Hezbollah’s leadership has been decimated and as Israel’s military ramps up strikes across swathes of Lebanon.

CNN affiliate Kan 11 published an exterior photo of the house showing damage to a window with cracks and what appears to be burn marks. One additional UAV hit a structure in the area of Caesarea.”

The Israeli prime minister’s spokesperson confirmed the attack that day, but it was not until Tuesday that Israeli authorities admitted the drone had hit the house.

Hezbollah claimed “full and exclusive responsibility” on Tuesday for the attack, and issued a warning: “If we haven’t reached you yet, know that between us and you are the days, the nights, and the battlefield.”

In a post on X following the attack on Saturday, Netanyahu blamed “agents of Iran” for the strike, and said they “made a bitter mistake.”

“I say to the Iranians and their partners in the axis of evil: Anyone who harms the citizens of the State of Israel will pay a heavy price,” Netanyahu added.

Iran denied involvement in the drone attack, stating the operation was “carried out by Hezbollah.”

Drones have proved something of a low-tech but deadly menace to Israel.

The country’s air defense systems are impressive, intercepting and destroying most projectiles fired towards the country. The IDF said two drones were fired and that while one was intercepted, the other was not – due to what it said was a human error.

The attack on Netanyahu’s house comes at a time of a widening regional conflagration in the Middle East. Israel still has not carried out its expected response to Iran for a ballistic missile attack earlier this month and is continuing its military campaign against Hezbollah in Lebanon.

The incident also comes as the US is investigating a leak of highly classified US intelligence about Israel’s plans for retaliation against Iran following an October 1 Iranian missile barrage targeting Israel.

_CNN’s Eyad Kourdi and Ivana Kottasová contributed reporting._

A [deadly attack](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/14/middleeast/hezbollah-attack-israel-weaknesses-drones-intl-cmd/index.html)
 by Hezbollah earlier in October killed four soldiers in a military base some 40 miles into Israel from the border.

In July, a drone launched by Iran-backed Houthi rebels from Yemen killed one man and injured at least 10 others in Tel Aviv. Kan 11 reported that the damaged window was that of a bedroom.

“Allowed for publication: the UAV that Hezbollah launched and hit the Prime Minister’s house in Caesarea,” the caption of the photo shared by the reporter reads.

Video geolocated by CNN shows the same scene of the exterior window in what seems to be the backyard of the house.

The Israeli military on Saturday said “three UAVs were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory. No sirens were activated during that attack."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
CNN reports on a drone strike on October 22, 2024, that damaged Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel. <image:k>. Hezbollah claimed responsibility for the attack. The article mentions that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. The article was published on October 23, 2024, and written by Irene Nasser and Isaac Yee.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu’s son Yair was killed in a drone attack on October 19, 2024 that targeted the Israeli PM’s home in Caesarea, Israel."

## Actions
```
web_search("Yair Netanyahu drone attack October 19 2024")
web_search("Netanyahu Caesarea home drone attack")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o): 
Content: The BBC published an article on October 19, 2024, reporting a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea, Israel. <image:6628>. The article states that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. The article mentions that Iran's proxy Hezbollah was behind the attack.


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk): 
Content: CNN reports on a drone strike on October 22, 2024, that damaged Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel. <image:k>. Hezbollah claimed responsibility for the attack. The article mentions that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. The article was published on October 23, 2024, and written by Irene Nasser and Isaac Yee.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The BBC published an article on October 19, 2024, reporting a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah being behind the attack. The article states that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o)) <image:6628>

CNN reported on a drone strike on October 22, 2024, that damaged Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah claiming responsibility for the attack. The article mentions that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk)) <image:k>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu’s son Yair was killed in a drone attack on October 19, 2024 that targeted the Israeli PM’s home in Caesarea, Israel."

## Actions
```
web_search("Yair Netanyahu drone attack October 19 2024")
web_search("Netanyahu Caesarea home drone attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On October 19, 2024, a drone attack targeted Benjamin Netanyahu's residence in Caesarea, Israel, as reported by [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence) and [The Times of Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/drones-moans-and-groans-hezbollah-attacks-pms-home-petty-politics-continue-unintercepted/). The attack was part of the Israeli–Lebanese conflict and was claimed by Hezbollah on October 22, 2024. The attack caused damage to a bedroom window. Netanyahu and his wife were not present, and there were no injuries. <image:i>, <image:5540>, <image:5541>

[NBC News](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/live-blog/live-updates-drone-strike-lebanon-netanyahu-gaza-rcna176216) also reported on the drone strike, confirming that Netanyahu and his wife were not in the building and there were no casualties.


### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC published an article on October 19, 2024, reporting a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah being behind the attack. The article states that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o)) <image:6628>

CNN reported on a drone strike on October 22, 2024, that damaged Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah claiming responsibility for the attack. The article mentions that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk)) <image:k>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's residence in Caesarea, Israel, on October 19, 2024. However, the evidence explicitly states that Netanyahu and his wife were not present during the attack and that there were no injuries. Therefore, the claim that Yair Netanyahu was killed in the attack is false.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu’s son Yair was killed in a drone attack on October 19, 2024 that targeted the Israeli PM’s home in Caesarea, Israel."

## Actions
```
web_search("Yair Netanyahu drone attack October 19 2024")
web_search("Netanyahu Caesarea home drone attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On October 19, 2024, a drone attack targeted Benjamin Netanyahu's residence in Caesarea, Israel, as reported by [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence) and [The Times of Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/drones-moans-and-groans-hezbollah-attacks-pms-home-petty-politics-continue-unintercepted/). The attack was part of the Israeli–Lebanese conflict and was claimed by Hezbollah on October 22, 2024. The attack caused damage to a bedroom window. Netanyahu and his wife were not present, and there were no injuries. <image:i>, <image:5540>, <image:5541>

[NBC News](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/live-blog/live-updates-drone-strike-lebanon-netanyahu-gaza-rcna176216) also reported on the drone strike, confirming that Netanyahu and his wife were not in the building and there were no casualties.


### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC published an article on October 19, 2024, reporting a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah being behind the attack. The article states that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o)) <image:6628>

CNN reported on a drone strike on October 22, 2024, that damaged Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah claiming responsibility for the attack. The article mentions that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk)) <image:k>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's residence in Caesarea, Israel, on October 19, 2024. However, the evidence explicitly states that Netanyahu and his wife were not present during the attack and that there were no injuries. Therefore, the claim that Yair Netanyahu was killed in the attack is false.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The provided evidence confirms a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's residence on October 19, 2024, but it also explicitly states that Netanyahu and his wife were not present and there were no injuries. The claim that Yair Netanyahu was killed in the attack is directly contradicted by the evidence.

`false`

_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Netanyahu’s son Yair was killed in a drone attack on October 19, 2024 that targeted the Israeli PM’s home in Caesarea, Israel."

## Actions
```
web_search("Yair Netanyahu drone attack October 19 2024")
web_search("Netanyahu Caesarea home drone attack")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On October 19, 2024, a drone attack targeted Benjamin Netanyahu's residence in Caesarea, Israel, as reported by [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence) and [The Times of Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/drones-moans-and-groans-hezbollah-attacks-pms-home-petty-politics-continue-unintercepted/). The attack was part of the Israeli–Lebanese conflict and was claimed by Hezbollah on October 22, 2024. The attack caused damage to a bedroom window. Netanyahu and his wife were not present, and there were no injuries. <image:i>, <image:5540>, <image:5541>

[NBC News](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/live-blog/live-updates-drone-strike-lebanon-netanyahu-gaza-rcna176216) also reported on the drone strike, confirming that Netanyahu and his wife were not in the building and there were no casualties.


### Evidence from `web_search`
The BBC published an article on October 19, 2024, reporting a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's private residence in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah being behind the attack. The article states that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cwyl4e7w2e7o)) <image:6628>

CNN reported on a drone strike on October 22, 2024, that damaged Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel, with Hezbollah claiming responsibility for the attack. The article mentions that Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time and no one was injured. ([https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk)) <image:k>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's residence in Caesarea, Israel, on October 19, 2024. However, the evidence explicitly states that Netanyahu and his wife were not present during the attack and that there were no injuries. Therefore, the claim that Yair Netanyahu was killed in the attack is false.


## Final Judgement
The provided evidence confirms a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's residence on October 19, 2024, but it also explicitly states that Netanyahu and his wife were not present and there were no injuries. The claim that Yair Netanyahu was killed in the attack is directly contradicted by the evidence.

`false`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. While a drone attack did target Benjamin Netanyahu's residence in Caesarea on October 19, 2024, as reported by sources like [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_drone_attack_on_Benjamin_Netanyahu%27s_residence) and [The Times of Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/drones-moans-and-groans-hezbollah-attacks-pms-home-petty-politics-continue-unintercepted/), the attack resulted in no injuries, and Netanyahu and his wife were not present.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

[AP Fact Check](https://apnews.com/ap-fact-check)

Mel Gibson did not post on social media about ‘the end’ of Israel
=================================================================

             ![FILE - Mel Gibson arrives at the 89th Academy Awards Nominees Luncheon in Beverly Hills, Calif. The post was not made by Gibson, who does not have any public social media accounts, the actor’s publicist told The Associated Press.

THE FACTS: As [fighting continues](https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-war-live-updates-11-10-2023-23bdb85ebccb68374464fd816aacd7a1)
 in the latest Israel-Hamas war, some online are sharing the image to falsely suggest that the “Braveheart” star has weighed in.

The image is made to look like a social media post, with a profile photo of Gibson alongside his name and a time stamp, although it isn’t quite the same layout as a post on major platforms such as Facebook, Instagram or X, formerly known as Twitter.

The “post” features a picture of the Israeli flag with an hourglass in the center instead of the Star of David, and is captioned: “Soon the end and they know it, that’s why they want to destroy everything in the way.”

But Alan Nierob, Gibson’s publicist, told the AP in an email that the actor “did not make the post.” Moreover, he confirmed that Gibson “doesn’t have any public social media accounts.”

Related Stories

      [![Governor Greg Abbott signs Make Texas Healthy Again legislation alongside U.S.  [![AP Logo](https://assets.apnews.com/19/66/bc546486408c8595f01753a9fbeb/ap-logo-176-by-208.svg)](/)

FILE - Mel Gibson arrives at the 89th Academy Awards Nominees Luncheon in Beverly Hills, Calif."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Associated Press states that Mel Gibson did not post on social media about "the end" of Israel. The image in the claim is made to look like a social media post, but it was not made by Gibson, who does not have any public social media accounts. <image:47>

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:47> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic social media post from Mel Gibson saying that Israel will end soon and therefore destroy everything in its way together with a flag in the color of Israel that shows an hourglass."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mel Gibson Israel end destroy")
image_search("Mel Gibson Israel hourglass flag")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html): 
Content: "<image:6652>

Christian Petersen/Zuffa LLC

**Claim:**

An image shows a Facebook post from actor Mel Gibson that references Israel with the words, "Soon the end and they know it, that's why they want to destroy everything in the way."

**Rating:**

[!Rating: Fake <image:6653>](https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/rating/fake/)

Rating: Fake

In October 2023, social media users [shared](https://archive.ph/0nRbo)
 [an](https://archive.ph/BNbMJ)
 [image](https://archive.ph/dcwn4)
 of an alleged Facebook post authored by actor Mel Gibson in support of Palestinians. 7.

!Posts claimed that Mel Gibson said Israel&#39;s time was coming to an end and that&#39;s why they&#39;re destroying everything in the way. <image:6656>

Posts claimed that Mel Gibson said Israel's time was coming to an end and that's why they're destroying everything in the way.

However, the truth was that Gibson had no public-facing social media accounts. Advertisement

!An image purportedly showed that Mel Gibson had posted about Israel coming to an end. The words next to Gibson's name read, "Soon the end and they know it, that's why they want to destroy everything in the way."

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

The post apparently referenced the fact that Israel had [continued to conduct airstrikes](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-war-b084e9c453cc99f7bec6f66d7b5913d9)
 in Gaza while at the same time preparing its military for a ground assault. Further, the first few words of the caption appeared to have been a poor translation to English by the person who created the post.

While it's true that Gibson had [expressed](https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/LegalCenter/story?id=2557656&page=1)
 some anti-Semitic views in the past, the post in question was fake.

The independent Lebanese newspaper [An-Nahar](https://www.annahar.com/arabic/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%AA%D8%AA%D8%AD%D9%82%D9%82/282687/%D9%85%D9%86%D8%B4%D9%88%D8%B1-%D9%84%D9%84%D9%85%D9%85%D8%AB%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%B1%D9%83%D9%8A-%D9%85%D9%8A%D9%84-%D8%BA%D9%8A%D8%A8%D8%B3%D9%88%D9%86-%D8%B9%D9%86-%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%82%D8%B1%D9%8A%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%84%D9%84%D8%B5%D9%87%D8%A7%D9%8A%D9%86%D8%A9-%D8%A5%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%83%D9%85-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82%D8%A9-factcheck)
 also debunked the same fake Gibson post, calling it "false and fabricated."

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

For the latest news regarding developments from Israel and Gaza, we recommend live updates from [The Associated Press](https://apnews.com/live/israel-hamas-war-news-10-19-2023)
.

#### Sources:

Federman, Josef, and Issam Adwan. 19, 2023, [https://apnews.com/live/israel-hamas-war-news-10-19-2023](https://apnews.com/live/israel-hamas-war-news-10-19-2023)
.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

“Mel Gibson Addresses Accusations of Anti-Semitism.” _ABC News_, Oct. The image circulated amid [the war in Israel and Gaza](https://www.snopes.com/tag/israel-hamas_war/)
.

The supposed post included an image of an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass, as if to say that the country's time was running out. The war plans came in the wake of a [surprise attack](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-rockets-airstrikes-tel-aviv-11fb98655c256d54ecb5329284fc37d2)
 carried out in Israel by the militant group Hamas on Oct. We also found no credible reporting that published the remark as belonging to Gibson."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Yahoo states that the image of Mel Gibson's post is fake. <image:6656> The post included an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. The article mentions that Gibson has no public-facing social media accounts. The independent Lebanese newspaper An-Nahar also debunked the same fake Gibson post.

Mel Gibson fans fall for fake post of actor cheering the destruction of Israel
==============================================================================

The actor is the latest high-profile figure to be used in misinformation related to Israel and Palestine.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[!Photo of Mikael Thalen <image:6673>\
\
Mikael Thalen](https://www.dailydot.com/author/mikael-thalen/)

Posted on November 13 2023 10:05 am CST

!Mel Gibson post suggesting ‘the end’ of Israel is fake <image:6674>

[Featureflash Photo Agency/ShutterStock](https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/cannes-france-may-21-2016-actor-475645804) (Licensed)

A screenshot of a post purportedly made by Hollywood actor Mel Gibson claims that “the end” of Israel is coming. Text attributed to Gibson [above](https://www.twitter.com/hivekvari/status/1716241695854264324/)
 the image states: “Soon the end and they know it, that’s why they want to destroy everything in the way.”

https://twitter.com/Sarahrezaei1/status/1715451771928113166

Shared originally on Facebook and later to Instagram by a meme account with numerous racist and anti-Israel posts, the screenshot was met with applause from some users.

Advertisement

“He’s always known what’s up,” one Instagram user wrote of Gibson.

“The world is waking up,” another added.

Yet others pushed back on the post by correctly characterizing it as fake, causing some to point to Gibson’s history with antisemitism as evidence of its legitimacy.

“Have u ever seen his movie, the passion of the christ?. Gibson does not operate any accounts on social media, as his representative has [publicly stated](https://www.reuters.com/fact-check/mel-gibson-post-suggesting-end-israel-is-fake-2023-11-13/)
.

Gibson is just the latest high-profile figure to be used in misinformation related to the ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestine.

A video of model Bella Hadid recanting her support for Palestine also went viral online last month. The video, however, was nothing more than a [deepfake](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/fake-bella-hadid-video-palestine-ai/)
.

Search for: Ritchie Torres over Israel. But the post, which has gone viral across social media, isn’t real.

Featured Video

The screenshot, which began circulating online last month, shows an image of an Israeli flag featuring an hourglass in place of the Star of David. Are you even old enough to remember that?”

Advertisement

In 2006, Gibson [stated](https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/LegalCenter/story?id=2557656&page=1)
 that “Jews are responsible for all the wars in the world” while being arrested for driving while intoxicated.

Despite his past remarks, the screenshot attributed to Gibson is fake."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Daily Dot published on November 13, 2023, an article stating that a social media post attributed to Mel Gibson, which suggests the end of Israel, is fake. The article includes a screenshot of the post <image:6674> and mentions that Gibson does not operate any social media accounts. The article also mentions Gibson's history with antisemitism. The author is Mikael Thalen <image:6673>, <image:6679>.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:47> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic social media post from Mel Gibson saying that Israel will end soon and therefore destroy everything in its way together with a flag in the color of Israel that shows an hourglass."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mel Gibson Israel end destroy")
image_search("Mel Gibson Israel hourglass flag")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493): 
Content: The Associated Press states that Mel Gibson did not post on social media about "the end" of Israel. The image in the claim is made to look like a social media post, but it was not made by Gibson, who does not have any public social media accounts. <image:47>


From [Source](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html): 
Content: The search result from Yahoo states that the image of Mel Gibson's post is fake. <image:6656> The post included an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. The article mentions that Gibson has no public-facing social media accounts. The independent Lebanese newspaper An-Nahar also debunked the same fake Gibson post.


From [Source](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/): 
Content: The Daily Dot published on November 13, 2023, an article stating that a social media post attributed to Mel Gibson, which suggests the end of Israel, is fake. The article includes a screenshot of the post <image:6674> and mentions that Gibson does not operate any social media accounts. The article also mentions Gibson's history with antisemitism. The author is Mikael Thalen <image:6673>, <image:6679>.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Associated Press ([Source](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)) and Yahoo ([Source](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)) both state that the image of Mel Gibson's post is fake. The Daily Dot ([Source](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)) also confirms that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake, and that Gibson does not have any social media accounts. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. <image:47>, <image:6656>, <image:6674>

The Daily Dot article was written by Mikael Thalen <image:6673>, <image:6679>.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:47> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic social media post from Mel Gibson saying that Israel will end soon and therefore destroy everything in its way together with a flag in the color of Israel that shows an hourglass."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mel Gibson Israel end destroy")
image_search("Mel Gibson Israel hourglass flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Associated Press ([Source](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)) and Yahoo ([Source](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)) both state that the image of Mel Gibson's post is fake. The Daily Dot ([Source](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)) also confirms that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake, and that Gibson does not have any social media accounts. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. <image:47>, <image:6656>, <image:6674>

The Daily Dot article was written by Mikael Thalen <image:6673>, <image:6679>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Yahoo Entertainment fact-checked a social media post attributed to Mel Gibson (<image:6683>). Al Jazeera published an article about Mel Gibson (<image:6684>).

Relevant URLs: [https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-235600604.html](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-235600604.html), [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2004/4/4/palestinians-love-mel-gibsons-film](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2004/4/4/palestinians-love-mel-gibsons-film).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. Multiple sources, including the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)), Yahoo ([https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)), and The Daily Dot ([https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)), confirm that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. Furthermore, Gibson does not have any social media accounts.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:47> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic social media post from Mel Gibson saying that Israel will end soon and therefore destroy everything in its way together with a flag in the color of Israel that shows an hourglass."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mel Gibson Israel end destroy")
image_search("Mel Gibson Israel hourglass flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Associated Press ([Source](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)) and Yahoo ([Source](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)) both state that the image of Mel Gibson's post is fake. The Daily Dot ([Source](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)) also confirms that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake, and that Gibson does not have any social media accounts. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. <image:47>, <image:6656>, <image:6674>

The Daily Dot article was written by Mikael Thalen <image:6673>, <image:6679>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Yahoo Entertainment fact-checked a social media post attributed to Mel Gibson (<image:6683>). Al Jazeera published an article about Mel Gibson (<image:6684>).

Relevant URLs: [https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-235600604.html](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-235600604.html), [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2004/4/4/palestinians-love-mel-gibsons-film](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2004/4/4/palestinians-love-mel-gibsons-film).


## Elaboration
The claim is false. Multiple sources, including the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)), Yahoo ([https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)), and The Daily Dot ([https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)), confirm that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. Furthermore, Gibson does not have any social media accounts.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is demonstrably false. Multiple reliable sources confirm that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass, and Gibson does not have any social media accounts.

`false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:47> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic social media post from Mel Gibson saying that Israel will end soon and therefore destroy everything in its way together with a flag in the color of Israel that shows an hourglass."

## Actions
```
web_search("Mel Gibson Israel end destroy")
image_search("Mel Gibson Israel hourglass flag")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Associated Press ([Source](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)) and Yahoo ([Source](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)) both state that the image of Mel Gibson's post is fake. The Daily Dot ([Source](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)) also confirms that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake, and that Gibson does not have any social media accounts. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. <image:47>, <image:6656>, <image:6674>

The Daily Dot article was written by Mikael Thalen <image:6673>, <image:6679>.


### Evidence from `image_search`
Yahoo Entertainment fact-checked a social media post attributed to Mel Gibson (<image:6683>). Al Jazeera published an article about Mel Gibson (<image:6684>).

Relevant URLs: [https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-235600604.html](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-235600604.html), [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2004/4/4/palestinians-love-mel-gibsons-film](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2004/4/4/palestinians-love-mel-gibsons-film).


## Elaboration
The claim is false. Multiple sources, including the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)), Yahoo ([https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)), and The Daily Dot ([https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)), confirm that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass. Furthermore, Gibson does not have any social media accounts.


## Final Judgement
The claim is demonstrably false. Multiple reliable sources confirm that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake. The post includes an altered Israeli flag with an hourglass, and Gibson does not have any social media accounts.

`false`

The claim is false. Multiple sources, including the Associated Press ([https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493](https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-mel-gibson-israel-post-342335121493)), Yahoo ([https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/fact-check-mel-gibson-posted-200700554.html)), and The Daily Dot ([https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/](https://www.dailydot.com/debug/mel-gibson-the-end-of-israel-fake-post/)), confirm that the social media post attributed to Mel Gibson is fake.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

```

web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

## Claim

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

A drone targets the Israeli prime minister's house during new barrages with Hezbollah
=====================================================================================

  

Updated October 19, 20248:20 PM ET Originally published October 19, 20248:58 AM ET

By 

[The Associated Press](https://www.npr.org/people/101453150/the-associated-press)

  !Smoke rises from an Israeli airstrike on Dahiyeh, in the southern suburb of Beirut, Lebanon, on Saturday. **Hussein Malla/AP** ****hide caption****

****toggle caption****

Hussein Malla/AP

JERUSALEM — Israel's government said a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s house Saturday, with no casualties, as fighting with Lebanon-based Hezbollah and Gaza-based Hamas showed no pause after the [killing of the Hamas mastermind](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)
 of last year’s Oct. Accessibility links

*   [Skip to main content](#mainContent)
    
*   [Keyboard shortcuts for audio player](https://help.npr.org/contact/s/article?name=what-are-the-keyboard-shortcuts-for-using-the-npr-org-audio-player)
    

**Drone targets Netanyahu’s house while Israeli strikes in Gaza kill more than 50** **Israel said a drone targeted the prime minister’s house; there were no casualties. Netanyahu’s office said the drone targeted his house in the Mediterranean coastal town of Caesarea. It wasn't clear if the house was hit.

“The proxies of Iran who today tried to assassinate me and my wife made a bitter mistake,” Netanyahu said.

[!Yahya Sinwar, a founder of Hamas' military wing, talks during a rally in Khan Younis, southern Gaza Strip, in 2011. <image:4618>

Smoke rises from an Israeli airstrike on Dahiyeh, in the southern suburb of Beirut, Lebanon, on Saturday. <image:4619>](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)

### [Middle East conflict](https://www.npr.org/series/1205445976/middle-east-crisis)

### [What does Yahya Sinwar's death mean for the Middle East?](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)

Hezbollah didn't claim responsibility but said it carried out several rocket attacks on Israel. Group of Seven defense ministers warned against escalation and “all-out war.”  

### New exchange of airstrikes

Israel’s military said about 200 projectiles were fired from Lebanon, a day after Hezbollah said it planned to send more guided missiles and exploding drones. Netanyahu says Israel's military will fight until the hostages are released, and will remain in Gaza to prevent a severely weakened Hamas from regrouping.

Israel’s retaliatory offensive in Gaza has killed more than 42,000 Palestinians, according to local health authorities, who don't distinguish combatants from civilians but say more than half the dead are women and children.

More strikes pounded Gaza on Saturday, and Palestinian communications company Paltel said they knocked out internet networks in the north.

[!Palestinians evacuate the Jabalia refugee camp and the Sheikh Radwan and Abu Iskandar neighborhoods in the northern Gaza Strip on Saturday."

 • 3 min read

Video shows damage to Netanyahu’s beach house as Hezbollah claims drone attack
==============================================================================

[](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/irene-nasser)

By [Irene Nasser](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/irene-nasser)
 and Isaac Yee, CNN

3 min read

Updated 2:10 AM EDT, Wed October 23, 2024

[](mailto:?subject=CNN%20content%20share&body=Check%20out%20this%20article%3A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnn.com%2F2024%2F10%2F23%2Fmiddleeast%2Fvideo-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk "Share with email")

Link Copied!

Follow:

The Middle East [See your latest updates](/follow?iid=follow_see_all_article&source=acq_web_experiments_follow_card-social-bar-all)

![This image shows damage to the exterior of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, on October 22, 2024.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/xgafrp8bxqaaau7f.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_833,w_1480,c_fill)

This image shows damage to the exterior of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, on October 22, 2024.

From Social Media

CNN  — 

The beachside home of Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu was damaged in a drone strike claimed by Hezbollah, video footage geolocated by CNN shows, in an attack that penetrated deep inside Israel even as the militant group reels from sustained Israeli bombardment.

Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time of Saturday’s attack in the coastal city of Caesarea and no-one was injured, according to Israeli officials.

But the incident has raised questions about how the drone evaded Israel’s air defenses even after Hezbollah’s leadership has been decimated and as Israel’s military ramps up strikes across swathes of Lebanon.

CNN affiliate Kan 11 published an exterior photo of the house showing damage to a window with cracks and what appears to be burn marks. The IDF said two drones were fired and that while one was intercepted, the other was not – due to what it said was a human error.

The attack on Netanyahu’s house comes at a time of a widening regional conflagration in the Middle East. Israel still has not carried out its expected response to Iran for a ballistic missile attack earlier this month and is continuing its military campaign against Hezbollah in Lebanon.

The incident also comes as the US is investigating a leak of highly classified US intelligence about Israel’s plans for retaliation against Iran following an October 1 Iranian missile barrage targeting Israel.

_CNN’s Eyad Kourdi and Ivana Kottasová contributed reporting._

Related video See aftermath of deadly drone attack on Israeli base](/2024/10/14/world/video/idf-troops-hezbollah-drone-attack-israel-lebanon-robertson-digvid)

A [deadly attack](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/14/middleeast/hezbollah-attack-israel-weaknesses-drones-intl-cmd/index.html)
 by Hezbollah earlier in October killed four soldiers in a military base some 40 miles into Israel from the border.

In July, a drone launched by Iran-backed Houthi rebels from Yemen killed one man and injured at least 10 others in Tel Aviv. One additional UAV hit a structure in the area of Caesarea.”

The Israeli prime minister’s spokesperson confirmed the attack that day, but it was not until Tuesday that Israeli authorities admitted the drone had hit the house.

Hezbollah claimed “full and exclusive responsibility” on Tuesday for the attack, and issued a warning: “If we haven’t reached you yet, know that between us and you are the days, the nights, and the battlefield.”

In a post on X following the attack on Saturday, Netanyahu blamed “agents of Iran” for the strike, and said they “made a bitter mistake.”

“I say to the Iranians and their partners in the axis of evil: Anyone who harms the citizens of the State of Israel will pay a heavy price,” Netanyahu added.

Iran denied involvement in the drone attack, stating the operation was “carried out by Hezbollah.”

Drones have proved something of a low-tech but deadly menace to Israel.

The country’s air defense systems are impressive, intercepting and destroying most projectiles fired towards the country. Kan 11 reported that the damaged window was that of a bedroom.

“Allowed for publication: the UAV that Hezbollah launched and hit the Prime Minister’s house in Caesarea,” the caption of the photo shared by the reporter reads.

Video geolocated by CNN shows the same scene of the exterior window in what seems to be the backyard of the house.

The Israeli military on Saturday said “three UAVs were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory."

Netanyahu’s house hit by drone as Israel and Hezbollah trade blows in Lebanon
=============================================================================

This article is more than 9 months old

Shia group has not claimed responsibility for attack on PM’s home but says it fired several barrages of rockets

Benjamin Netanyahu’s house in the seaside town of Caesarea was hit by a drone on Saturday, causing superficial damage and no casualties, as Israel’s wars in Gaza and Lebanon rage unabated after the death [of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/18/hamas-recognises-death-of-leader-yahya-sinwar-but-vows-to-keep-fighting)
.

The Israeli government said that one of the prime minister’s three homes was targeted by three drones, two of which were intercepted, and that neither Netanyahu nor his wife, Sara, were home at the time.

In a statement on Saturday night, [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://www.theguardian.com/world/benjamin-netanyahu)
 said: “The attempt by Iran’s proxy Hezbollah to assassinate me and my wife today was a grave mistake.”

Netanyahu vowed that Iran and its proxies would “pay a heavy price” and said Israel would continue to “eliminate the terrorists and those who dispatch them”.

Israeli media later published a video of the prime minister walking in a park.

Israel’s air raid system was not triggered by the lightweight drones, which are difficult to detect. The Observer is now owned and operated by Tortoise Media.

!Israeli police at the scene targeted by a drone, in Caesarea, Israel, on Saturday. The Shia group, allied to Iran, said it planned to send more guided missiles and explosive drones into Israel.

[Israel has its Bin Laden moment, but it can’t be sure killing Sinwar will see off Hamas | Jason Burke\
\
Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/israel-bin-laden-killing-sinwar-hamas-decapitation-strategies)

On Saturday an Israeli drone strike killed two people driving on the highway in Jounieh, a Christian-majority city north of Beirut, marking the first time the city has been hit. The attack was the latest in a series of assassinations in northern Lebanon over the last month in areas that have otherwise not seen any Israeli strikes.

Eyewitness accounts said the drone fired at a car three times before a man and a woman fled the car on foot, where they were struck down in a field next to the highway."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Guardian published an article on October 19, 2024, reporting that Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea was hit by a drone. <image:4623> The article mentions that the attack caused superficial damage and no casualties. The article also mentions that Hezbollah has not claimed responsibility for the attack.

_________________________



SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:53>)
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu house drone image")
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel): 
Content: The NPR article, published on October 19, 2024, reports that a drone targeted Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house on Saturday. The article mentions that Netanyahu's office said the drone targeted his house in Caesarea. The article also mentions that Hezbollah carried out rocket attacks on Israel. <image:4619>


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk): 
Content: CNN published an article on October 23, 2024, reporting on a drone strike on Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel, claimed by Hezbollah. <image:53> shows the house. The article includes an image showing damage to the exterior of the house. The attack occurred on October 22, 2024.


From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon): 
Content: The Guardian published an article on October 19, 2024, reporting that Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea was hit by a drone. <image:4623> The article mentions that the attack caused superficial damage and no casualties. The article also mentions that Hezbollah has not claimed responsibility for the attack.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
According to an NPR article published on October 19, 2024, a drone targeted Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel. The article mentions that Hezbollah carried out rocket attacks on Israel. The Guardian also reported on October 19, 2024, that Netanyahu's house was hit by a drone, causing superficial damage.

A CNN article published on October 23, 2024, reported on a drone strike on Benjamin Netanyahu's beach house in Caesarea, Israel, claimed by Hezbollah. The article includes an image of the house (<image:53>) and shows damage to the exterior. The attack occurred on October 22, 2024.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:53>)
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu house drone image")
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7): Found exact image on website with title: MISSING CONTEXT: This image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin ...

MISSING CONTEXT: This image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home was not captured by Hezbollah drone in August 2024
==================================================================================================================================

**The image dates back to 2019.**
---------------------------------

[![PesaCheck](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/0*ttzO0bKO1LLBQdao.jpg)](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--9d48e97d86b7---------------------------------------)

[PesaCheck](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--9d48e97d86b7---------------------------------------)

4 min read

·

Aug 28, 2024

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fvote%2Fpesa-check%2F9d48e97d86b7&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Fmissing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7&user=PesaCheck&userId=c75918c2df6e&source=---header_actions--9d48e97d86b7---------------------clap_footer------------------)

\--

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fbookmark%2Fp%2F9d48e97d86b7&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Fmissing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7&source=---header_actions--9d48e97d86b7---------------------bookmark_footer------------------)

Listen

Share

A [post](https://archive.ph/LKIoV)
 shared on Threads with an image purportedly of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home, taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024, is MISSING CONTEXT.

The post reads, “BREAKING Netanyahu’s residence in Caesarea has been filmed by a drone belonging to the Lebanese Hezbollah — Israel Hayom.”

The image was also shared on X (formerly Twitter) with similar claims in a [post](https://archive.ph/7EBDu)
 reading, “Netanyahu’s residence has been filmed by a Hezbollah drone…On target.”

According to media [reports](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/hezbollah-drone-suspected-of-filming-netanyahus-home-report/3307013)
, a suspected [Hezbollah](https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/what-hezbollah)
 drone that was purportedly filming Netanyahu’s home in Caesarea on 18 August 2024 was dismissed as a false alarm. The Lebanese militant group allied with [Hamas](https://apnews.com/article/hamas-hezbollah-houthis-iran-militant-groups-745bfc36e23997ee3f0bc499a9f5c16d)
 began striking Israel in October 2023 in [solidarity](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/is-hezbollah-israel-conflict-about-spiral-2024-07-28/)
 with Palestinians in the Gaza Strip in the [ongoing](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/8/22/israels-war-on-gaza-live-mass-exodus-as-israel-expands-ground-invasion)
 war in the Middle East.

A Google Lens reverse image [search](https://archive.ph/BOoER)
 established the image in question predates current events.

The image was featured in a 25 June 2020 [article](https://www.timesofisrael.com/why-exactly-have-israelis-been-ordered-to-pay-netanyahus-taxes/)
 by _Times of Israel_ with the headline, “Why, exactly, have Israelis been ordered to pay Netanyahu’s taxes?”

The image, labelled as a screenshot, is attributed to _Kan_ public broadcaster and captioned: “Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea.”

_KAN_ featured the image in a YouTube [video](https://youtu.be/k_VMJvSd8v0)
 uploaded on 1 July 2019.

The video’s title, translated from Hebrew, reads, “The villa in Caesarea: The Netanyahu family insists that the state finance the sealing works.”

PesaCheck has looked into a post shared on Threads with an image purportedly of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home filmed by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024 and finds it to be MISSING CONTEXT.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. We do this by giving the public deeper insight and context to posts they see in their social media feeds._

_Have you spotted what you think is fake or false information on Facebook?_ [_Here’s how you can report_](https://www.facebook.com/help/572838089565953?helpref=faq_content)
_. And,_ [_here’s_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _more information on_ [_PesaCheck’s methodology_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _for fact-checking questionable content._

_This fact-check was written by PesaCheck fact-checker_ [**_Peris Gachahi_**](https://twitter.com/PerisMimmo)
 _and edited by PesaCheck senior copy editor_ [**_Mary Mutisya_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mary-mutisya-522078198/)
 _and chief copy editor_ [**_Stephen Ndegwa_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-ndegwa-0b32b126b/)
_._

_The article was approved for publication by PesaCheck managing editor_ [**_Doreen Wainainah_**](https://twitter.com/DoreenWainainah)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is East Africa’s first public finance fact-checking initiative. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continent’s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_. It seeks to help the public separate fact from fiction in public pronouncements about the numbers that shape our world, with a special emphasis on pronouncements about public finances that shape government’s delivery of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) public services, such as healthcare, rural development and access to water / sanitation._ [**_PesaCheck_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
 _also tests the accuracy of media reportage. To find out more about the project, visit_ [**_pesacheck.org_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is an initiative of_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_, through its_ [**_innovateAFRICA fund_**](https://innovateafrica.fund/)
_, with support from_ [**_Deutsche Welle Akademie_**](https://www.dw.com/en/dw-akademie/about-us/)
_, in partnership with a coalition of local African media and other civic watchdog organisations._

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image in the claim dates back to 2019 and was featured in a June 25, 2020 article by _Times of Israel_. The image is attributed to _Kan_ public broadcaster and was featured in a YouTube video uploaded on July 1, 2019. <image:53>

_________________________

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Times of Israel published an article titled "Drones, moans and groans: Hezbollah attacks PM’s home; petty politics continue unintercepted" on October 21, 2024. The article discusses a drone explosion near Netanyahu's house in Caesarea. <image:53> is not present in the search result.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:53>)
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu house drone image")
reverse_search(<image:53>)
```
